titleStmt.title: Lilli's propheticall history of this yeares accidence, 1642. Or, Newes from the grammar-school, taken suddenly sick all over with conceite, occasioned by the doctors desperate opinion of her state, finding hoc regnum in the second declension. Wherein is found a preposition for the kings returning Londinum versus, going imediately before the concord. The misery of the times beating into our brains the memory of our first rules, all in one methode, for an everlasting impression of both, never to be forgotten.
titleStmt.author: W. S.

notesStmt.note: From t.p., enclosed within border of printer's ornaments, "The Author to the Reader. What means these tears, sobs, sighs, the land all o're? Why? Grammar's sick. Was't ever so before? W.S."
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
